properties.text: @OLAASM a distinction should be drawn between the policy makers in the Democratic Party and people regularly hoodwinked by those policies
@OLAASM people are not generally win over by rubbing their face in their illusions.
@nwbtcw solidarity unionism not only violates virtually all collective bargaining agreements. It is also illegal under Taft Harley.
@nwbtcw of course, the reason being that organized sectors of the American working class have been in retreat former than a generation.
@nwbtcw and that's why it's illegal but the law could be passed is because of a more generalized retreat by labor for more than 70 years
@nwbtcw I'm more skeptical about the inevitability of progressive change. Of course there will be resistance. Success is another matter.
@genderfork could it not also mean the opportunity to be pretty?
@OLAASM of course there is no electoral choice in America where there are two big capitalist parties and the vast majority have no party
@OLAASM but the Democratic Party is not our party. It is only the more moderate wing of capitalism. We need a mass party of our own.
@OLAASM the fight between Democrats and Republicans is reasonable from a capitalist perspective. There is no mass party of the vast majority
@JannScott @olaasm oh bullshit. Need a party of our own which ain't the fucking Democrats which is only a moderate bourgeois party.

So I'm laying here in the hospital bed with virtually no clothes on. Very humiliating. It would be more fun if they ran it like the Baths.
Really miserable. http://t.co/69vukA9m
They unhooked me. I got dressed and walked down the hall. Started feeling light headed and laid down.
6' waves in the Delaware Bay
@fowlerruth Christie threw me out of Atlantic City. I came to NYC for shelter only to find Bloomberg had shut down the subways.
@fowlerruth on top of everything I just got out of surgery a day ago.

The problem is not the personal dishonesty of political and business leaders but rather a system that rewards such behavior. @ctizzie
Why is someone who stares at a painting of a beautiful woman an art lover and someone who stares at a living breathing woman a creep?

@guidogir @msmagazine @99rise the whole 99rise movement is nothing but a distraction from the task of organizing, we need money to do that.
@AlexStevens @izzynastasia
@AlexStevens @izzynastasia the Nation is a mouthpiece for left wing Democrats and so naturally is going to make a big deal about this crap
@AlexStevens @izzynastasia do not be hoodwinked by this mouth piece of left liberalism. We need a journal of our own.
The 99rise mvt is doing exactly the opposite of what needs to be done. We need more money coming to us and not administered by the state!
@AlexStevens @izzynastasia instead of petitioning banks we should be picketing every union hall demanding a labor party!
@ctizzie you should vote. The right to vote is an important victory for democracy and to loose it would be a terrible loss.
@ctizzie there are several noncapitalist parties to choose from. Their totals won't amount to much but it will be a space holder.
@99rise @izzynastasia more than a movement, we need a party of our own which not accomplished by telling the state to take our money.
@IzzyNastasia like Popeye "I am what I am". Check my profile. I'm an open book.
@IzzyNastasia no but we are friends of friends.
@IzzyNastasia do not trust this capitalist state to find elections. We need money to build our own party.
@IzzyNastasia the 99rise movement is not simply misguided but fundamentally reactionary. Fuck the state.
@IzzyNastasia the worst reActionary causes are those that act militant and pretend to be progressive.
@IzzyNastasia it's nuts to trust the cApitalist state to fund elections. We need all the money we can get to build our own party.
@IzzyNastasia @kai_newkirk @99rise snazzy direct action may be snazzy but to what end?  The capitalist state already has too much control.
I just voted. It always gives me a good feeling even though I realize that voting is such a small part of the democratic process.
@mary_menville conflicted about what?  The Republicans suck. The Democrats suck. The only conflict is weather to vote Green or Socialist.
Not voting is what Gore Vidal called "conscientious nonparticipation" and given the paucity of choice people have a right to do that.
@mary_menville sure the dens and republicans are bourgeois parties. How bourgeois parties rule is complex but that's no reason 2 vote 4 them
@mary_menville and in the absence of a mass party of opposition they are frankly clueless as to how "the system" actually works.
@ivanmarovic @99rise @thenation idealist young people are risking arrest because they have been hoodwinked by moronic liberal cynics.
@mary_menville I don't think the system is broken. I think it's working just fine for the people running it, just not for the vast majority
@mary_menville from our point of view it was never broken because it was never meant to serve our needs and never has.
In the absence of a mass party of opposition politics degenerates into a struggle between personalities. @IzzyNastasia @AlexStevens
"Getting the money out of politics" will do nothing to enrich the political discourse and will ultimately undermine democracy @IzzyNastasia
@99rise @champpr  Bourgeois politics will always have plenty of money. We need a party of our own. Everything else is a distraction.
